title.narrative: PASF forest sector support in Burkina Faso

description.narrative: The general objective of the Programme is the sustainable management of forests and the contribution to sustainable rural development which will generate sustainable growth in the rural sector and thereby effectively reduce poverty and food insecurity. The specific objectives of the Programme are: 1 Contribute to participatory and sustainable management of forests 2 Increase the contribution of the forestry sector to the national economy and the population’s well-being 3 Contribute to improved environmental governance and the promotion of sustainable development by improving the capacity for adaptation and mitigation of climate change 4 Ensure an efficient public support to the forestry sector by building capacity of the Ministère de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable (MEDD)

Joint funding together with Luxemburg to PASF which is a direct support to the sub-programmes of the sector programme PNSR (agriculture-forestry-animal husbandry) which falls under the Ministry of environment. Support is envisaged during 3 years.
Tillsammans med Luxemburg finansieras PASF som är ett stöd till miljöministeriets del (4 tematiska program) av sektorprogrammet PNSR (jord-skog-husdjur). Stöd planeras under 3 år.

participating-org.narrative: Pasf-Medd Ministere De L’Economie Et Des Finances, Ouagadougo

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The final report of the PASF 51200019 project is very short but covers the essential. In the narrative report, the evaluation carried out in 2018 is quoted: "the implementation was not efficient". It can be added that the project was conceived as the first step to a sector programme. Therefore it was extremely wide thematic-wise and involved many actors within the Ministry of enviornment (MEEVCC). The lack of clear focus and the high number of internal actors are important explanations to the poor results. Another cause, which has however not been officially established, is the lack of engagement among the ministry staff for achieving results in the field. Too much energy was devoted to internal work, workshops, etc. PASF intervened in 6 of Burkina Faso's 13 regions and the 4 four specific objectives touched on the following topics: 1 Improved forest management 2 Improved local economy (for poor households) 3 Adaptation to climate change 4 Strengthen the capacity of MEEVCC A total of approximately 17 million Euro was used by the project. Luxemburg contributed 65% and Sweden 35%. The physical implementation rate was assessed to 94%. The evaluation estimated, in spite of the fairly negative over-all assessment, that 7 results were achieved, 2 partly achieved and 1 not achieved. The main results were as follows: INFORMATION/SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT: - Documents on local forest management were produced and dissiminated - A number of important studies were conducted - The national forest inventory got valuable support from PASF - Envirnmental statistics were published by the national statistics institute INSD, thanks to data provided by PASF FOREST MANAGEMENT - The Fonds d'Intervention pour l'Environnement/FIE, a national enviornmental fund was created - 22,000 hectares of forest was covered by management plans - 15 forest management plans were prepared - 3,500 hectares of communal (municipal) forests were established CAPACITY BUILDING OF THE MEEVCC - 4893 persons were trained on decentralised forest management - 30,000 people were trained on forestry techniques - Equipment was delivered to three locations - 33 new legal texts were adopted - 6000 copies of the new forest & environment law was printed and distributed Two important main results should be highlighted: 1 Strengthening of the internal administrative and financial capacity of the MEEVCC 2 The creation of the environmental fund FIE, which now is targeted by the government and the Green Climate Fund/GCF as becoming the first national entity to be accredited by the GFC.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
